text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai 
kitchen so today i am making thai

marinated grilled steak but the marinade i 
truly believe is the only marinade recipe you

need and i will explain to you why once 
i show you the recipe this is simple it's

a crowd pleaser every single time let's get 
started by the way the name of this recipe is

neua yang neua means beef and yang means to grill the marinade so 
we're going to start out with black pepper which i

used to do white and black but for beef you know 
what you got to go with black get that pounded up
all right and now some garlic

and if you don't have more than pestle you can 
use a microplane to finely grate the garlic
oh it smells good already just garlic and pepper

there we go you want it nice and fine and then 
i have some oyster sauce going in oyster sauce

just does magic to marinated meat so good and soy 
sauce i'm using thai soy sauce but you can go with

any kind that you've got handy and then 
a little bit of acidity to brighten up

the flavors i'm going to add some lime juice 
and to balance all the really salty and sweet

and acidic stuff that we just added i'm going 
to add some sugar you can add a little bit less

a little bit more or none at all this is a 
great thing about this marinade recipe is

it's endlessly customizable if you like 
sort of like that teriyaki flavor where

it's a little bit sweet you can add even more 
than this but i think this amount it's a good

standard thai flavor a little salty just a tiny 
bit of sweet some oil and the oil will help

coat the beef and prevent it from drying out and 
also it will help sort of extract the flavors from

the garlic and the pepper which a lot of those 
flavors are fat soluble so it's always a good

idea to have a little bit of fat in marinade and 
that's it how easy is that time to reveal my meat

so for this recipe you can use any kind 
of steak that you want but i am going with

flat iron today let me turn it around this way 
which is a great cut for the grill however when it

comes to marinating steak you want to go with thin 
steaks not a big thick one because the marinade

can only work but around the surface right so you 
want to give it a lot of space to work with so i'm

looking at this and i'm going to actually cut 
it into three pieces one here and one down here

just because this is a thinner edge now i'm going 
to just place this into my marinating vessel is

there room for me almost here's our money shot 
of the day i promised i would tell you why i

think this is the only marinade recipe you need 
beyond the fact that it's incredibly delicious

it's asian but there's nothing here that just 
screams at you whoa so asian like it's got a

neutral enough flavor profile that even if you 
weren't making a thai meal it would still it

would go with mashed potatoes no problem you can 
put gravy on it no problem there's no sesame oil

or pandan leaves or anything like that so it will 
actually it's just like a bunch of really umami

ingredients also it is endlessly customizable 
if you do want it to be distinctly asian you can

add whatever ingredients herb spices that you've 
got to here just keeping sort of the basic ratio

again adjusting the sugar if you want it sweeter 
less sweet not sweet at all it's completely up

to you so if you've got this as your base formula 
you don't need anything else ideally you want to

do it for a minimum of three hours but i would 
suggest just doing the day before and the next

day it'll be fantastic if you're doing less than 
three hours it's okay but it's not as good okay

because the marinade needs time to work so i guard 
i've already got some with the magic of television

done in advance from yesterday and so i'm going 
to go and grill this now couple tips for grilling

steaks you want to make sure your steak has been 
sitting out at room temperature for about an

hour that'll make for more even doneness and for 
the perfect grill marks you want to first put

the steak at 10 o'clock once you've got some nice 
marks move it to two o'clock and that is how you

get the perfect cross hatch i also don't close the 
lid of the grill when i do this because i don't

want them to cook too quickly and then they will 
not have time to develop those nice grill marks

if you've got a thick side it's nice to get 
some grill marks along the sides as well

and you can grill this to whatever doneness you 
prefer but i always recommend using a instant

read thermometer to make sure you get exactly 
what you're looking for we've got the only steak

that you need resting and you want to give it 
five to ten minutes for something that size

now i'm going to show you the only steak dipping 
sauce you need at least if you're a thai person

okay if you're eating steak and your thai there is 
no steak without nam tim tell which is what we're

about to make right now starting with toasted rice 
powder and so this is just plain rice it can be

jasmine rice it could be sticky rice toasted 
until it's deep brown like this i also threw

in some lime leaves some macro lime leaves just 
for extra flavor and we're going to grind that up

yeah that's good it doesn't have to be completely 
powderized remember this ratio that i'm going to

give you for nam tim tao and you can use 
this for any kind of grilled meat chicken

fish whatever and if you want to tinker with 
it you can but the ratio you want to start with

is two one one one one two tamarind paste 
i made this from pulp which i would suggest

you do but the store-bought one would work in 
the pinch one part fish sauce that's our salty

one part lime juice that's our sour the 
other sour the tamarind is also sour

and one palm sugar and you want to give this a 
good stir until most of the sugar is dissolved

so that's your ratio and if you taste it and you 
like it sweeter more sour you can adjust but the

one 211 is very useful chili flakes as much as you 
want so this is roasted chili flakes i basically

took dry chilies toasted a little bit and ground 
it up that's it you can use any sort of spicy

anything chopped shallot not necessary you can 
also do green onions instead my toasted rice is

going to go in now oh and this is an absolute must 
right here like you cannot have nam timto without

the toasted rice like it's just not not down oh it 
smells so good you add that it's over oh so good

some greenery i'm gonna add cilantro you can 
do mint or again green onions as i mentioned

if you're making the dipping sauce in advance 
you want to hold the cilantro till last minute

to keep them fresh ugh the smell of everything the 
cilantro goes in and it's like la freshness okay

good all right it's time 
to reveal the grilled steak

oh oh look at that grilling perfection 
that is just about how i like it done

about medium i don't love medium rare for this 
and culturally in thailand we only do medium and

above okay even well done which i know is awful 
but i think medium is great so now in thailand

you never give somebody a hunger stake and hand 
them a knife and a fork okay that is just not done

steak is sliced into pieces and everybody 
share a little bit okay so that's what

we're gonna do here nice thin slices also in 
thailand meats tend to be on the chewier side

like we don't really have you know a culture 
of premium steaks or anything like that

so thin will also help with chewiness as well you 
have no idea how hard it is for me to not eat one

right now ah okay i'm gonna do it i'm gonna 
do the end piece because i just cannot wait
oh it's perfect well the end piece is the best

so as the person who cooks you eat that end piece 
you're entitled to it you deserve it you do not

let that piece go to the people okay nice look 
at that of course we got the dipping sauce and

it's not over the most important part of this 
arguably has been sitting behind me this whole

time and some of you sharp eyes noticed sticky 
rice and yes this is sticky rice made in the

traditional bamboo cone steamer if you want to 
know how to use this i do have a video with seven

different ways you can make sticky rice but this 
is the traditional original and arguably best way

so cute boom right there and yes sticky 
rice is hand food people one last tasting
with the dipping sauce

i'm ending on a high note 
right here with this recipe

so good i'm gonna let adam 
taste the steak just on its own

oh you should see him he's like writhing 
on the ground and it's not overly asian

it doesn't taste like oh this is 
definitely asian food so if you

had pasta salad potato salad mashed potato 
whatever you want it will work just fine

it's a great basic formula that you can add 
other herbs and spices if you want it to be

something a little more distinct but i'm telling 
you with this one right here that's all you need

good job because it's not complete without the 
sticky rice and that's it the recipe will be on

hathaikitchen.com as always a special thanks to 
all of our patreon supporters who help support

the show and if you want to know what that's 
all about how you can watch my videos ad free

and get bonus content with every episode you can 
check out more information in the link below if

you make this dish definitely tag me on social 
media at hot thai kitchen i'd love to see it

thank you as always for watching and i will 
see you next time for your next delicious pie
